blog.name: tennantsforever
blog.title: David Tennant's fan
blog.description: "Keep having reasons to get up in the morning" - David Tennant

body:
Dear fans

I have seen so many rude, ugly comments under both Georgia’s and David Tennant does a podcast with…’s posts. The way David looks is his bloody business,not yours. You are not entitled to say he looks bad because of his facial hair or that he has to change it. Maybe it’s for the role, maybe it’s his new style. Doesn’t matter. He is a human being, with a right to live his life the way he wants. So stop ranting about and just be respectful, because this is getting really annoying.

reblog.comment:

He is a human being, with a right to live his life the way he wants. So stop ranting about and just be respectful, because this is getting really annoying.

summary: Tenth Doctor: At the time it had been the death of a stranger, and he could hardly mourn the loss of someone he had barely met....
caption: Tenth Doctor: At the time it had been the death of a stranger, and he could hardly mourn the loss of someone he had barely met. But since then he had bumped into younger versions of her a couple of times. Inevitably they’d grown closer—now, the memory of her death was hurting more than it had in the moment. How much more would it hurt, as he made his way into a future that was already her past? —The Day of The Doctor Novelisation by Steven Moffat

reblog.comment: Tenth Doctor: At the time it had been the death of a stranger, and he could hardly mourn the loss of someone he had barely met. But since then he had bumped into younger versions of her a couple of times. Inevitably they’d grown closer—now, the memory of her death was hurting more than it had in the moment. How much more would it hurt, as he made his way into a future that was already her past? —The Day of The Doctor Novelisation by Steven Moffat

trail.content_raw: Tenth Doctor: At the time it had been the death of a stranger, and he could hardly mourn the loss of someone he had barely met. But since then he had bumped into younger versions of her a couple of times. Inevitably they’d grown closer—now, the memory of her death was hurting more than it had in the moment. How much more would it hurt, as he made his way into a future that was already her past? —The Day of The Doctor Novelisation by Steven Moffat
trail.content: Tenth Doctor: At the time it had been the death of a stranger, and he could hardly mourn the loss of someone he had barely met. But since then he had bumped into younger versions of her a couple of times. Inevitably they’d grown closer—now, the memory of her death was hurting more than it had in the moment. How much more would it hurt, as he made his way into a future that was already her past? —The Day of The Doctor Novelisation by Steven Moffat

title: The Ideal Doctor Who
body:
The Ideal #DoctorWho - examining who the Doctor is, and what he means to each of us.

You won’t be surprised that my ideal Doctor Whostory would be written by John Dorney, and star Paul McGann and Nicola Walker, Peter Capaldi and Matt Lucas, and possibly Alex Macqueen. It would score high on the campometer but have flashes of cold steel and heart-wrenching shadows of deepest darkness. If you’re salivating already, I apologise, as that’s NOT where I’m going here; by “Ideal”, I…

View On WordPress
